attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to follow the policy of free trade globally
attributes.background: In this new age the UK needs to apply policies that reflect and encourage commerce throughout all nations and islands of the United Kingdom and to encourage this with all nations we trade with. This will show a willingness for free market economics to promote prosperity globally not just the UK.

attributes.action: If the UK is forced to leave the EU, the government should apply to rejoin it.
attributes.background:
On 23rd June the EU referendum returned a small majority in favour of the UK leaving the EU. As of yet it is still unclear whether or not Article 50 will be invoked and we actually have to leave.

Should the UK be forced to leave the EU then the government should begin proceedings to rejoin it.

attributes.action: General elections after the UK referendum and after presentation of BREXIT plan
attributes.background: The referendum resultet in a small minority of just over 50% of voters to leave the EU. The political leadership is broken down, negativ economical effects have emerged already. The UK situation is historically unique and has long term effects for future generations. General elections are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: The economic, political and social future of the UK is uncertain for years. The referendum was not a vote for a Brexiteer government.  Brexiteers need to come up with a short, medium and long term plan and well thought through vision, present this to parliament and the population. The same applies for other parties. Immediately afterwards, the populations needs to have the right to choose which party they trust most with this challenging tasks ahead through their vote in general elections .

attributes.action: Ensure level 3 BTEC's are not equivelant to 3 A levels
attributes.background: According to the board of education, a Level 3 BTEC is equivelent to 3 A- levels. However the amount of work, stress, perserverance and time spent completing A levels is far from on par with that endured from BTEC students.
attributes.additional_details:
'Even students who win places at prestigious Russell Group universities on the back of top results in BTECs are much less likely to gain a first or 2:1 and more than 40 per cent fail to complete their degree course, with many withdrawing because of “academic failure”.'- The Sunday Times.
A- Level students are experienced with high levels of stress and mental endurance due to the courses sat, and so is it just they have to compete for university places that will most probably be dropped out of?

attributes.action: Majority should be of electorate in referenda, with provision for indecision
attributes.background: We call on parliament to ensure that referenda base the majority on the entire electorate rather than on turnout, and have provision for the scenario where the public as a whole is undecided. In which case, our elected MPs must continue the debate and consider rephrasing the question to the public.

attributes.action: Reform this country before deciding on enacting Article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Mass migration was seen as many to be a root cause for dissent with the EU, yet some UK firms advertise exclusively in Eastern European countries to take advantage of cheap labour. Change our laws to prevent this. Any building firm that hires migrant workers to employ the same number of apprentices
attributes.additional_details: Also, boost money into the NHS by properly claiming with the E111 system or enforcing health insurance for non-EU visitors.  In the Oct 2013 yougov report, this could save £500million annually. All UK residents must pay taxes for 12months before being eligible for benefits. This will also empower our youth to get off benefits as most migrants are much less likely to claim benefits. If UK firms must pay UK and non-UK people the same salary, there is much less incentive for mass migration

attributes.action: Organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate immigrants living & working in the UK
attributes.background: Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

attributes.action: Give landlords more power to self evict bad tenants who break their contracts
attributes.background: My husband and I are landlords of one property and have had some terrible tenants who either feel it's ok to not pay rent or flout other parts of the contract. We have just had our rental completely trashed and landlord insurance covers a tiny fraction. We are working class people who work hard.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/Bernard.Bernie.Mac/posts/10154331015367160

attributes.action: Keep the same workers rights as the EU
attributes.background: Keeping the same workers rights as the EU would keep our holiday pay, sick pay, maternity leave, and follow the 48 hour working time directive.

attributes.action: Raise the salary for childcare workers in the early years sector
attributes.background: Childcare workers in the early years have one of the most important jobs in the sector as a whole. They are responsible for the early education, health and wellbeing of children under 5. A rewarding job is there ever was one however this is not reflected in their salaries.
attributes.additional_details: The average full time childcare worker in the early years sector makes less than £1050 per month after deductions. This simply is not reflective of the love, hard work, sacrifice and determination to give the future the best possible start in life. As a childcare worker there is no greater joy than helping a child succeed at being a child and being happy, healthy and confident. But job satisfaction can only take you so far when a roof over your head is needed.

attributes.action: Change legislation and bring back the 500cc 2 stroke motorcycle engine.
attributes.background: Now that we are coming out of the EU, its about time the large 2 stroke motorcycle engine is brought back to the uk. It makes riding a motorcycle much more fun that a heavy old 4 stroke.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.gizmag.com/honda-two-stroke-with-fuel-injection-patent-filing/38529/
http://www.dirtrider.com/honda-building-efi-controlled-direct-injected-two-stroke

attributes.action: Stop Expatriates Having A Vote On British Issues Such As Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Just over 4.5 million Britons live abroad with approximately 1.3 million of them in Europe. Allowing them to vote on British issues severely alters the results of elections and referendums.
If Britain isn't good enough for them to live or pay Tax in then why should they have a say in how it is run?
attributes.additional_details:
We saw during the EU referendum over a million Spanish expats (selfishly) tried to vote 'stay' in Europe purely because they wanted to keep their NHS benefits abroad! Not for the good of the country.

Sign if you believe British Expats who do not live or pay Tax in the Britain should NOT be able to vote in Britain!

attributes.action: Second EU referendum if the UK fall into a recession.
attributes.background: Due to the dramatic drop in the value of GBP following the 'leave' party winning the 'Brexit' vote, It is highly likely that the UK will fall into a recession and face brutal austerity. Sign this petition to trigger a second vote to alleviate it's affect on our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The current Chancellor of the Exchequer has predicted this recession will leave households £4,300 worse of on average.

attributes.action: Make hate crime an urgent national priority in the wake of the EU referendum.
attributes.background: There is mounting evidence that hate crimes are occurring as a direct result of the EU referendum. This must be dealt with firmly and swiftly by ensuring that every police force is ready and able to address this situation. It is spiralling out of control and many people are fearful.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.standard.co.uk/news/crime/police-probe-racist-signs-distributed-after-brexit-vote-in-eu-referendum-a3281021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/brexit-eu-referendum-racial-racism-abuse-hate-crime-reported-latest-leave-immigration-a7104191.html

attributes.action: Introduce pre-referendum as an entry requirement before future major referendums
attributes.background: Before important future referendum i.e. like should UK be in the EU or not? A pre-referendum is issued first  to ensure that eligible voters understand what they are voting for. The results of pre-referendum should be used as weighting to set the criteria that main referendum is considered passed.
attributes.additional_details: It is obvious from personal stories from friends and families and other stories trending on the internet that a significant number of people voted when they did not know what they were really voting for and also were using as a protest rather than considering and forming balanced opinion based on informed arguments for yes or no.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 4 visa applicants use partner/spouse's bank account as proof of funds
attributes.background: Current Tier 4 (General) visa policy does not allow any flexibility regarding proof of money available to support one's studies. Applicants cannot submit their partner/spouse's personal bank statement as evidence. What if they do not have a joint account? What if their parents cannot afford it?
attributes.additional_details: The current policy states that one can ONLY use one's personal/joint/parents' account bank statements or building society statements as proof of money (aka maintenance/funds) available to support one's studies, if one did not receive any official sponsorship or apply for any loan. However, given the fact that some of the applicants are married/in a civil partnership, allowing them to present their partner/spouse's bank statement is arguably rational.

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB

attributes.action: Hold a second EU membership referendum within 18 months.
attributes.background:
(1) Young people could not vote.
(2) Voters based their decision to leave on incomplete information.
(3) Winning margin was too narrow. 

A referendum of this weight should allow 16 - 17 year old people to vote. 

The UK should only exit if leave vote wins by a substantial margin.
attributes.additional_details:
(1) http://goo.gl/krTYyR (Independent)

(2) http://goo.gl/wBfX74 (The Guardian) and https://goo.gl/1Jd1Mp (Washington Post)

(3) http://goo.gl/SXEWTS (Mirror)

To quote the UKIP leadership, the winning margin was too narrow and therefore this is unfinished business by a long way.

The very existence of the United Kingdom as we know it and of the European Union, built over 7 decades, hangs in the balance.

attributes.action: EU referendum results CAN NOT be OVERTURNED or PETITIONED against within 4 years
attributes.background: If a referendum result has been won there should not be another referendum called to dispute the original within 4 years.

attributes.action: Re-establish faith in the UK by making all EU regulations UK law before leaving.
attributes.background: The UK must demonstrate to the world that it is a beacon of international collaboration, co-operation and responsibility. We should start by enshrining into UK law all the regulations and agreements that would expire when we leave the EU, so that it takes a change of law to break an agreement.
attributes.additional_details: We need to show that we don't discard our international agreements and responsibilities lightly, while also boosting confidence that things remain as they are now unless Parliament decides otherwise. We should adopt into law a presumption that each of our international commitments will remain in effect unless a new law is passed to revoke it. We don't want to throw out the good rules with the bad, and we should properly debate each rule we want to get rid of, and know which rules will go, when.

attributes.action: Calculate results based on number of registered voters even those who abstain.
attributes.background: The official result of the EU referendum was that 52% voted leave, whereas when the total number of registered voters was taken into account the result was only 37%. Likewise, in the last General Election in at least one area the number of abstainers was greater than the winning candidate's margin.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large portion of the country who choose not to vote as they believe it will make no difference. We the undersigned believe it's time to change the system so that result percentages are calculated using the number of registered voters and not only those who voted. We believe that this will give a more accurate picture of what the citizens of this country want.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Second EU referendum after a suggested "cool down" period of 2 months.
attributes.background: 23rd of June saw the United Kingdom EU referendum. Campaigning on both sides was not comprehensive enough for informed decisions to be made creating a failed democratic result with consequences only being realised after the1st referendum. A second, more informed, truthful referendum is required
attributes.additional_details: There have now been a number of revelations made by prominent Leave campaigners after the referendum has completed that what they said during the build up to the referendum was untrue. Democracy only functions when the populous has factually correct information in which to base their decisions - in the first referendum, this unfortunately was not the case. If a 2nd referendum is held and results are within 5% of each other, the decision should be given to the UK government to vote upon.

attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: The government should rerun the referendum on our membership of the EU.
attributes.background: The binary question of leave or remain should have a third choice: Remain as a member with reforms met within a specified deadline. If the deadline is not met then we leave.

attributes.action: Call another EU referendum for those aged 16-30
attributes.background: What should have been done previously and what should be addressed now, is the importance of the generation whom the EU referendum would effect. Therefore it is my request that as a generation, we should be given the choice, rather than our elders making that choice for us.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Count non-voters as a vote for the status quo in referendums.
attributes.background: People who vote do so to express their choice.  By not voting, people are saying they are not really concerned either way.  If they held a strong conviction they would have voted.  Change should not be imposed without taking these non-voters into account.
attributes.additional_details:
The in-out EU referendum is a case in point. Fewer than half the voting public voted for change but change will happen because insufficient people voted for the status quo.

Non-voters who weren't really concerned, or who didn't vote because they thought the status quo would win, should have their 'vote' counted.

To make a significant change (eg leaving the EU) more than half of the voting public should vote for it, ie not half of the voters.

attributes.action: Allow 15,16 and 17 year olds to vote in a second referendum.
attributes.background: The generation of people who were not allowed to vote will be the ones who are most affected by the change. Therefore they should be allowed a say in their future by having a vote in a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of 18-24 year olds voted remain, this shows that the young people of our population want to stay and should be given a chance to make this happen.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Give greater autonomy to Northern England and create a Northern Assembly
attributes.background: The North of England is a diverse and great place and deserves to have the same say about its own laws and futures as places such as Wales and Scotland.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its £534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: Ensure that in future, qualifying persons are automatically registered to vote.
attributes.background:
To vote in a UK election a person must be "registered to vote" and also: 18 or over, be a British citizen, a qualifying Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of the Republic of Ireland.

The requirement to register should be dropped so that those meeting criteria are automatically able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/electoral-register

attributes.action: Put more pressure on people and other countries to cut global warming
attributes.background: I understand that the government is already trying to cut down global warming but I still don't believe everything is being done. The purpose of a government is to better our future by learning from what has gone wrong. Flooding will increase with global warming, as will the cost of flood repairs..
attributes.additional_details: Sea levels are set to rise by twice as much as anticipated by the end of this century, showing that we are not prepared for the extent of the problems that this on going issue will create. The record for the lowest area of ice coverage in the Arctic is set to happen either this year or next year which creates yet another issue for our wildlife, which has been ignored because we rank the life of an endangered animal that doesn't contribute to pollution lower than our own.

attributes.action: Ban leashing dogs by their collar, in favour of front-chest harnesses
attributes.background:
Being leashed by the neck puts pressure and damage on:

- the trachea (windpipe)
- the spinal cord 
- the vertebral discs, 
- the oesophagus (gullet)

Harnesses offer better safety and comfort, alleviating pressure on the neck and also allowing the owner to better pull the dog from harms way.
attributes.additional_details: "I have observed the relationships between the neck injuries and health of dogs, and learned that if the flow of energy in the neck is interrupted or restricted, a whole array of problems may arise, including lameness, skin issues, allergies, lung and heart problems, digestive issues, ear and eye conditions and thyroid gland dysfunctions. I also suspect that the patients who have severe energy flow congestion in the neck area have higher cancer rates" - Dr. Peter Dobias, Holistic Veterinarian.
